active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue the pros and cons of manual source code review versus fully automated SAST in mobile app development. Use OWASP resources and a real-world breach example (e.g., a permission misuse in an Android app) to support your position. What hybrid approach would you recommend for high-risk mobile apps?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert cybersecurity educator specializing in flashcard generation for application security topics. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Source Code Review' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Mobile 008_Application Security > 010_Testing and Analysis Methodologies > Static 008_006_Application Security Testing (SAST) > Source Code Review). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema EXACTLY. **Content Synthesis (Web-Grounded Research):** Base on OWASP Secure Code Review Cheat Sheet (https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Secure_Code_Review_Cheat_Sheet.html), OWASP ASVS/MASVS for mobile, Secure Coding Practices Guide. Key elements: Manual review complements SAST by catching logic flaws; mobile specifics (Android permissions, iOS keychain, native vulns like JNI); processes (prep, review, report); SDLC integration; case studies (e.g., Android Stagefright). Prerequisites: SAST basics. Sources: OWASP.org cheat sheets, MASVS v2, CWE Top 25. **Instructions:** - Align flashcards to objectives (tag Bloom's level), scaffolding layers (tag layer), and include mobile examples. - Incorporate active learning: e.g., MCQs sparking discussion debates. - Follow schema: JSON array of objects with 'front' (question/options) and 'back' (answer/explanation/reference/active_learning_link). - Distractors per protocol. - Ensure progressive complexity: Layer 1 basic recall, Layer 4 synthesis. - Output ONLY valid JSON array, no extra text. Example Flashcard JSON: { "front": {"type": "MCQ", "question": "What differentiates manual source code review from automated SAST?", "options": ["A: Human context...", "B: ..."]}, "back": {"answer": "A", "explanation": "... (Bloom: REMEMBER, Layer:1)", "reference": "OWASP Cheat Sheet", "active_learning_link": "Discussion: Manual pros/cons"} } Generate 50 now.
